name: Hilton Garden Inn Mountain View

reviews.text: My husband was "put out " that I did not consult him before making reservations for our weekend stay. He was extremely please with our accommodations and even said he would stay again. The room, hallways , etc. were very clean. Our room was very quiet. The breakfast was great - and the room was cheerful overlooking the pool. After staying at other places for twice the price in nearby Palo Alto, we thought the value for our stay was great.
reviews.title: Great Stay

reviews.text: Highly recommend.
reviews.title: Very nice hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I stayed here for business for two nights, and I found it to be a very nice hotel. There were a lot of nice touches - free fruit and cookies at the front desk, free water bottles, free transport to my work and to the airport. The staff was all very nice; the room was clean and comfortable.
reviews.title: Will stay again!
No Mountain View at the "Mountain View" Hotel..
reviews.text: Clean, comfy, quiet and reasonable for the area. We just needed a place to sleep for two nights and we'll be back here on our next trip.

reviews.title: Great Hotel!
reviews.text: First) The "Mountain View Hotel" does not actually have a "Mountain View.." "Mountain View" is the name of the town. (This is VERY misleading,) Then the Front Desk had an "odd" attitude the entire time we were there. One Woman Day Clerk was consistently texting and had a hard time putting her cell phone down to talk with us. I didn't care for the room or the view of the parking lot from the beginning of our stay but was told they were "sold out" this is the only room left at 1pm in the Afternoon with an empty parking lot. When we checked in there was no Shower Curtain in the room. We were on our way to a meeting and Desk was in no hurry to replace the shower curtain so it turned into a "stand off".. At the end of the day I was late to my meeting waiting for them to bring a Shower Curtain. Also the maid skipped my room on Sunday. My next trip to this area I will stay some where else.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stopped one night in this hotel (a Hilton reward stay, btw), for we had to attend to a wedding in town.
reviews.title: Very nice hotel, but the staff could be more friendly

reviews.text: WE liked the hotel, loved the furniture, appreciated the location, but the staff hasn't been so friendly.
reviews.title: Moldy Smell Makes Public Areas Unpleasant

reviews.text: I'd stayed at this hotel some years back and it was fine. I needed an extra 2 nights in the immediate area and the hotel I'd been staying in couldn't accommodate me, but this one was able to take care of me immediately.
reviews.title: Solid Hilton, friendly staff, comfortable room

reviews.text: Upon arrival, I noticed a strong smell of mold in the entry area. I'm highly sensitive to mold, and this disturbed me. Since I'd already made the reservation, I figured I'd see how the room was. The front desk was friendly and efficient, and got me into my room right away. Fortunately, the room was fresh and clean, no mold smell at all. I was able to work and rest in the room with no problems, but every time I had to pass through the public areas, I was exposed to that pervasive smell.
reviews.title: Very nice, very comfortable and quiet!

reviews.text: This is a decent property with free parking and a great location for business in the Mountain View area, the wifi worked great, there are some nice amenities and the rooms themselves are pleasant enough. A look into the mold issue could really change the experience of this hotel.
reviews.title: Comfortable and convenient hotel with great staff

reviews.text: I have stayed here twice, on business, for a total of 7 nights. Rooms are nice size. Heat & air controls, small fridge, microwave, and coffee maker in-room. Common areas are beautiful and pleasant. Friendly staff. Small pool and a hot tub outdoors, decent gym and a nice business center are included. The have a "restaurant" although served buffet style. The breakfast is standard with chef to make eggs and omelets made to order. Unless you are a HUGE eater it is not worth the price. There is a grocery store directly across the street along with a nice sushi restaurant. I got microwaveable food and a box of utensils and saved my per diem for more reasonably priced meals.
reviews.title: Pleasant stay in Mountain View

reviews.text: All in all I enjoyed my stay in this nice little hotel.
reviews.title: This hotel gets EVERYTHING right!

reviews.text: We had a really excellent stay here. The room rate was very good and it included their wonderful breakfast buffet -- eggs and omelets cooked to order plus a large assortment of other hot and cold food choices -- really didn't need to eat lunch after eating breakfast here. The staff was always pleasant and helpful. There's some sort of hotel shuttle bus which we didn't use, and I"m not sure where it will take guests. There's a nice business center that is available to guests without charge. There were also other amenities that we didn't use such as a gym, pool, and laundry. The rooms were clean and in nice condition. Cookies and fruit were served in the evening. I would definitely come back here again.
reviews.title: Convenient location, good value

reviews.text: I've stayed here a few times now and it's always been a good value. Rooms and common areas are clean and pleasant. Friendly staff. They have a small pool and a hot tub outdoors, a tidy decent gym and a business center. The breakfast is quite good, with omelets made to order, though not included in the room rate unless you are a Hilton Gold member or alike. The location is convenient with easy access to Hwy 85 and 237, a grocery store across the street and restaurants nearby, even public transport along El Camino Real. There is some noise from the traffic though so you may want to choose a room away from the street.
reviews.title: Good for business...

reviews.text: Having stayed there before I've just left from staying there again. On the whole it is a decent property, a bit obtuse to get into streetwise (u-turns, etc) which is more a function of location.
reviews.title: Good Business Hotel

reviews.text: The property is immediately human and welcoming as the lobby is entered. It's open, warm and inviting. Check-in was fast and friendly. Expect a comfortable room with a mini fridge and micro wave. We really need to stay at more HGIs and fewer Hiltons.
reviews.title: Friendliness +

reviews.text: Great Hotel for business in the area. Staff is super nice.
reviews.title: Great Location

reviews.text: We stay at Hilton properties (and Garden Inn's in particular) a lot lately for business travel and found this spot in Mountain View which was perfectly situated for appointments in Palo Alto and Milpitas. This property is great.
reviews.title: Best Garden Inn Yet

reviews.text: While Garden Inn's in CA seem to be layed out similarly and have similar amenities, the management and staff at Hilton Garden Inn Mountain View seem to go above and beyond for their guests. It wasn't very busy on the day after New Years when we arrived and that may have been part of the extra attention, but it continued into the second day when more business clients seemed to arrive.
reviews.title: Pleasant Place

reviews.text: Hotel is very clean and neat - real flowers, lots of space to relax in the lobby. Food served all day - service and food was very good. Free (fast) wireless, nice work out room, pool and jacuzzi.
reviews.title: Good stay, great staff

aka: Hilton Garden Inn Mountain View Hotel Mountain View
